title: Processing... Try keeping the card still. Keycard not working on FP3
body:
# Bug Report


## Problem 
Processing... Try keeping the card still.

After entering the pin, it tells the message above, but never complete? How many minutes am I supposed to wait?

Beside: Cancel does not work properly. 
#### Expected behavior

Complete within a couple of minutes <5min.

#### Actual behavior

Hangs and does not report back why. At least a timeout should happen at some point or even better a counter counting down 10min f.i. 

### Reproduction

1) Open Status
2) Generate keys
3) Choose chat name
4) Advance -> Keycard -> Next
5) Begin setup
6) Looking for cards.. -> put card on back of phone -> Step 1 of 3 -> enter pin -> Looking for cards.. -> Connected -> Processing... Try keeping the card still. -> never completes. 

### Additional Information

- Status version: 1.14.0  
- Operating System: Android 10 /eOS/ Fairphone 3 (FP3) No Google Play Services installed (default on /eOS/, but microG is available)

If you tell me show I can get you some logs from the phone. adb commands or commands I can run on the terminal of the android phone are preferred. It is the 3 update I am put my hope in that my issue is fixed, but still no luck. I am hoping to deploy 3 cards as test with some friends as soon as I get it working for myself ;) 

![Screenshot](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/aRzYKUbfcozOwTzEEsPszgHg)

hey! we've add issues with the fairphone in the past, may you try NXP tag reader app wit your fairphone and see if you can read the keycard? It will help identify if the issue comes from the hardware or the software
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nxp.taginfolite&hl=en_US&gl=US

The NXP App gives me the following: 
`TagInfo scan: NXP Semiconductors Unknown IC implementing ISO/IEC 14443-4 tag with Java Card 04:84:6C:EA:DE:6A:80
`
Please be aware that there are no GooglePlayServices installed on /eOS/ only microG. The NXP TagInfo App is unable to save the full report, could be related to the missing GooglePlay. 

Any specific info you are looking for? I could provide you screenshots of what the app is displaying? 

There are a couple of FOSS apps on F-droid store, the ones I tried didn't output much more informations, any sugguestions (did not try them alll).

Always happy to see Fairphone users in the wild @mulles !

I've run into the same issue, but realize I didn't exhaust all suggestions to find the root cause. Based on the Status app and device logs it was concluded:

> The scenario is using NFC in reader mode with an ISO7816-4 card crashes after the first APDU/R-APDU pair is exchanged

In order to confirm, I was suggested to try:
> if you have an NFC Yubikey btw you could try that one too, it is also an ISO7816-4 tag so it should also crash if it is indeed a general firmware issue

I'll give that a try and update here this week (not my phone I have FP2 without NFC). Sharing as you might try that in the meantime if you have a Yubikey

@bitgamma @hesterbruikman  just had the chance to try the same keycard on another Fairphone 3 (I have a FP3+), worked without any problems. 
So I guess it is a software issue. As I am running IMG-e-0.18-q-20210827132307-dev-FP3.zip (https://gitlab.e.foundation/e/os/releases/-/releases) based an android Q ASOP/LineageOS(https://wiki.lineageos.org/devices/FP3/) and not the usual operating system coming with the phone!
